Function Documentation

void chemm ( char  side,
char  uplo,
int  m,
int  n,
complex  alpha,
complex *  a,
int  lda,
complex *  b,
int  ldb,
complex  beta,
complex *  c,
int  ldc 
)

chemm performs one of the Hermitian matrix-matrix multiplications for single precision complex numbers:

C := alpha * A * B + beta * C.

or

C := alpha * B * A + beta * C.

alpha and beta are scalars. A is an Hermitian matrix, and B and C are m by n matrices.

Parameters:
[in]sidespecifies whether A appears on left or right.
side = 'L' or 'l', C := alpha * A * B + beta * C..
side = 'R' or 'r', C := alpha * B * A + beta * C..
[in]uplospecifies whether upper or lower traingular part of A is referenced.
uplo = 'U' or 'u', upper traingular part of A is referenced.
uplo = 'L' or 'l', lower traingular part of A is referenced.
[in]mspecifies the number of rows of C.
[in]nspecifies the number of colums of C.
[in]alphamultiplication factor on matrix product.
[in]apointer to matrix A.
[in]ldafirst dimension of A.
[in]bpointer to matrix B.
[in]ldbfirst dimension of B.
[in]betamultiplication factor on C.
[in,out]cpointer to matrix C.
[in]ldcfirst dimension of C.
void chemmSC ( char  side,
char  uplo,
int  m,
int  n,
complex  alpha,
complex *  a,
int  lda,
complex *  b,
int  ldb,
complex  beta,
complex *  c,
int  ldc 
)

C := alpha * B * A + beta * C.
